message: Hello, I am Ethnobot
\What's your name?\
Jackie
Hi {previousValue}, nice to meet you!
What’s your Job?
Artist
Today I want you to help with a specific strand of Research for the Edinburgh City Council’s Public art research Project.
You will take me on a curated experience involving three works of art; art that is transformative, contentious, and new.
Are you ready to get started?
Yes
\Great!\
Please take me to a public work of art that is transformative...
Ok, let me know when we get there.
Are we there yet?
Yes
\What are we looking at? Take a pic and tell me it’s name.\
IMG_0005.JPG
and it’s name.
Work No 1059
Alright, I am gonna ask some deep questions now.
Who or what is this transformative for and why?
Who or what is this transformative for and why?
Are others affected?
No
Could you please expand on the quality, taste, and appropriateness of this work of art?

It has transformed a well used but disgusting set of steps in Edinburgh - one of many short cuts built to navigate the hilly typography of the city - with a beautiful thing that causes me to pause and look (at the marble) rather than race. That's all.
Focus on any or all points and take a pic if it helps.
Want to take a pic?
IMG_0006.JPG
Yes
I now know that the marble in each step was sourced from far and wide - a natural material
Anything else to add?
Yes

The work has transformed a well used but disgusting set of steps used as a short cut from Market St to North Bridge. The work causes me to pause every time I use it and look at the marble, enjoy the difference, think about where it came from.

The work has transformed a well used but disgusting set of steps used as a short cut from Market St to North Bridge. The work causes me to pause every time I use it and look at the marble, enjoy the difference, think about where it came from.

The work has transformed a well used but disgusting set of steps used as a short cut from Market St to North Bridge. The work causes me to pause every time I use it and look at the marble, enjoy the difference, think about where it came from.
It's by an artist I admire. It could do with cleaning more often - though the fact that so many homeless people use it as a toilet is in itself a fair comment on current times.
It's by an artist I admire. It could do with cleaning more often - though the fact that so many homeless people use it as a toilet is in itself a fair comment on current times.
It's by an artist I admire. It could do with cleaning more often - though the fact that so many homeless people use it as a toilet is in itself a fair comment on current times.
Could you expand on the context about this work of art?
No
Would you like to say anything else about this work of art or any issue related?
No
\Great let’s move on...\
Please take me to a public work of art that is contentious...
Ok, let me know when we get there.
Are we there yet?
Yes
\What are we looking at? Take a pic and tell me it’s name.\
IMG_0008.JPG
and it’s name.
Memorial to James Connolly
What makes this work of art contentious? And for whom?

It's contentious for many in Edinburgh, as there has long been a failure of the city (and Scotland) to recognise Connolly - as a Scot who changed history. Edinburgh has few memorials to the Irish immigrants who were such a big part of its history, it has long been overlooked.
Anything else to add?
Yes
It's tiny and hard to find. This also makes it contentious for those who consider his role in history important.
It's tiny and hard to find. This also makes it contentious for those who consider his role in history important.
It's tiny and hard to find. This also makes it contentious for those who consider his role in history important.
It's been given a tacky overhaul by supporters, which adds to its grim-ness
It's been given a tacky overhaul by supporters, which adds to its grim-ness
It's been given a tacky overhaul by supporters, which adds to its grim-ness
Our research shows contention raises issues of inclusivity and exclusivity... Does this work of art have issues with inclusivity and exclusivity?
Yes
What are the issues and affected parties? Take a pic if it helps...
Want to take a pic?
Yes
IMG_0009.JPG
It's been given a tacky overhaul by supporters, which adds to its grim-mess
Anything else to add?
Yes
Think I covered that in last answer - some feel excluded from history
Think I covered that in last answer - some feel excluded from history
Think I covered that in last answer - some feel excluded from history
Similarly contentious works of art have elements of trust and risk. Can you expand on either or both?
No
No, why not?
I'm cold and my hands are seizing up
Would you like to say anything more about this work of art or any issue related?
No
\Great let’s move on...\
Could you please take me to a public space that could use a new work of art or somewhere where a public work of art could be replaced?
Ok, let me know when we get there.
Are we there yet?
Yes
Are we placing or replacing?
New
\Where are we? Take a pic too\
IMG_0010.JPG
Not sure yet whether it's place or replace
Why have you chosen this place?
Add a pic if it helps...
Want to take a pic?
Yes
IMG_0011.JPG

This is the memorial to public hanging in the Grassmarket. Many died here but due to the nature of changes to the area it's now a real hub for drinking. (The monument/ area was opened in 1954). Its hard to think of this history when it is covered in beer and vomit stains.
How does this disrupt the space? And who will be affected and why?
Also, it's a natural seat/ stage (not usually a bad thing in public artworks but her it doesn't feel quite right.
Could you list the agencies, parties and individuals that should be involved for placing a work of art here?
Yes
A short list would be the Council and the pubs whose customers drink here
Is that all?
No
Go on...
In saying all that , the piper in my picture started to play Freedom Come All Ye by Hamish Henderson, which brought a wee tear to my eye.
In saying all that , the piper in my picture started to play Freedom Come All Ye by Hamish Henderson, which brought a wee tear to my eye.
In saying all that , the piper in my picture started to play Freedom Come All Ye by Hamish Henderson, which brought a wee tear to my eye.

Our research shows the process for a public art project can lack transparency for interested parties. Given the place and potentiality for a work of art here, can you imagine what a transparent process would be?
Yes
Please give me insight by steps or association and order-of groups involved.
The main thing is to spend a substantial amount of time looking at the site and how it's used
Anything else to add?
Yes
Get artists to lead, and give them funds and time to properly research, to look
Get artists to lead, and give them funds and time to properly research, to look
Get artists to lead, and give them funds and time to properly research, to look
A good public art management team/ person is essential
A good public art management team/ person is essential
A good public art management team/ person is essential
Well, that’s a lot to think about... Are there any other issues that you would like to address in the context of process?
No
In this place and process, what expertise does the public have to offer?
Some, but not all
Anything else to add?
No
Our research indicates particular issues are left out of the conversation when logistics and process take precedent about the use of a public space. Can you reflect on...?
Community
Please explain, add a pic if it helps
Want to take a pic?
No
Not everything stems from community engagement - it's one part. City centres are didficult for public art as they are so overrun with tourists. Much more interesting things can happen away from this
Anything else?
No
Would you Like to address a different issue?
No
Would you like to say anything more about any issues related to our current conversation?
No
That’s pretty much everything!
Thank you for your patience and participation But before you return me, do you have anything you would like to underscore or add to the conversation?
No
That’s all good. You’ve been a great help towards this research....
